result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Irene Huewe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Restitution to remain open 30 days. (No restitution was requested after the 30 day mark)

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM Defendant Kayla Irene Huewe in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Irene Huewe.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to sole count, a withheld sentence for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include 30 days conditional jail with no credit, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, continuation of no contact with victim and restitution to remain open for 30 days. State has complied with victim rights. Attorney Hoffman asks for huber for work. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights she is waiving by her plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes a withheld sentence for 2 years of probation. Conditions of probation include 30 days conditional jail with no credit (start date of September 15 at 6:00 pm)- huber for work, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, pay mandatory court costs, continuation of no contact with victim and restitution to remain open for 30 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:08 AM Defendant Kayla Irene Huewe appeared by video.  Attorney Chad Lalor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Irene Huewe. Court calls case. Attorney indicates some negotiations had. Reached agreement. Asks for plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:05 AM Defendant Kayla Irene Huewe appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Irene Huewe. Court calls case. State indicates offer pending. Asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:55 AM Defendant Kayla Irene Huewe appeared by video.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Kayla Irene Huewe. Court calls case. Attorney receives information, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Asks for status conference. State agrees.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim #1 and no use or possession of alcohol; no contact with establishments that serve alcohol

01:59 PM Defendant Kayla Irene Huewe in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hoffman-verifies address;   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Request preliminary hearing
Court-warrant quashed based on appearance
Court-request 500.00 cash bail; no contact with victim #1 and no alcohol
Atty Hoffman-local ties; works in area; no money to post today; no missed court appearances; request $1500-2000 signature bond
Court-concerned with felony charges; Court orders 3000.00 signature bond-no contact with victim #1 , no use or possession of alcohol and no entering establishments that serve alcohol
Warrant is quashed based on appearance today  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 10:45 am.
